timeline.message:
Fixed: Model reader logging bugs.

* The lines read from the stdout/stderr of the handler will now be
logged on a distinct logger (the MODEL_LOGGER). This gives much finer
grained control over logging in custom handlers.
* The metrics logger is now initialized via and sl4j logging factory
rather than through log4j. The call to log metrics was slightly modified
to fit with this more generic logger which only accepts String
arguments.

timeline.bodyText: These changes store model log in separate log files. It is much easier for user to control model log format. The only problem is that the mapping information b/w frontend worker thread id and backend worker pid is missing. It will be difficult to debug TS to detect if there is sth wrong with frontend worker thread.
timeline.author: lxning

replies.bodyText: Hi, thanks for having a look. Where do you think the PID message should end up?
replies.author: aparmentier-coveo

replies.bodyText:
current model log example as following:
2021-03-16 17:27:09,260 [INFO ] W-9001-vgg11_v2_1.0-stdout org.pytorch.serve.wlm.WorkerLifeCycle - Connection accepted: /home/model-server/tmp/.ts.sock.9001.
this pr model log example as following. Here, it is difficult to know which frontend worker thread has problem from the log.
2021-03-16 02:02:41,569 [INFO ] MODEL_LOG - Listening on port: /home/model-server/tmp/.ts.sock.9006
2021-03-16 02:02:41,576 [INFO ] MODEL_LOG - Listening on port: /home/model-server/tmp/.ts.sock.9002
2021-03-16 02:02:41,573 [INFO ] MODEL_LOG - Listening on port: /home/model-server/tmp/.ts.sock.9009
2021-03-16 02:02:41,566 [INFO ] MODEL_LOG - Listening on port: /home/model-server/tmp/.ts.sock.9015
2021-03-16 02:02:41,562 [INFO ] MODEL_LOG - Listening on port: /home/model-server/tmp/.ts.sock.9014
2021-03-16 02:02:41,562 [INFO ] MODEL_LOG - Listening on port: /home/model-server/tmp/.ts.sock.9007
2021-03-16 02:02:41,587 [INFO ] MODEL_LOG - [PID]55
2021-03-16 02:02:41,588 [INFO ] MODEL_LOG - Torch worker started.
2021-03-16 02:02:41,588 [INFO ] MODEL_LOG - Python runtime: 3.6.9
2021-03-16 02:02:41,587 [INFO ] MODEL_LOG - [PID]54
2021-03-16 02:02:41,589 [INFO ] MODEL_LOG - [PID]56
2021-03-16 02:02:41,589 [INFO ] MODEL_LOG - [PID]59
2021-03-16 02:02:41,589 [INFO ] MODEL_LOG - Torch worker started.
2021-03-16 02:02:41,590 [INFO ] MODEL_LOG - [PID]58
2021-03-16 02:02:41,590 [INFO ] MODEL_LOG - [PID]57
2021-03-16 02:02:41,590 [INFO ] MODEL_LOG - Listening on port: /home/model-server/tmp/.ts.sock.9004
2021-03-16 02:02:41,592 [INFO ] MODEL_LOG - Torch worker started.
2021-03-16 02:02:41,592 [INFO ] MODEL_LOG - Torch worker started.
2021-03-16 02:02:41,593 [INFO ] MODEL_LOG - Python runtime: 3.6.9
2021-03-16 02:02:41,591 [INFO ] MODEL_LOG - Python runtime: 3.6.9
2021-03-16 02:02:41,591 [INFO ] MODEL_LOG - Torch worker started.
2021-03-16 02:02:41,590 [INFO ] MODEL_LOG - Torch worker started.
2021-03-16 02:02:41,593 [INFO ] MODEL_LOG - Python runtime: 3.6.9
2021-03-16 02:02:41,593 [INFO ] MODEL_LOG - [PID]79
It would be very helpful if each message contains frontend worker thread id (eg. W-9001-vgg11_v2_1.0)  information in the model log.
replies.author: lxning

replies.bodyText: Oh I see, thank you. I think that would just be a change to the log4j default settings for the MODEL_LOG. I'll experiment and probably update this PR tomorrow.
replies.author: aparmentier-coveo

replies.bodyText:
I rebased and updated the default logging pattern format for MODEL_LOG to be the same as the other logs which include a thread name.
Cheers,
Alex
replies.author: aparmentier-coveo

* The lines read from the stdout/stderr of the handler will now be

* The metrics logger is now initialized via and sl4j logging factory
